text.0: strong godlynatured born for hero exploit mans friend hedoth whatever deed he willeth.
text.1: saving us een from great transgression indra the youthful visiteth mans home with favour.
text.2: waxing greatness indra slayeth vṛtra the hero with his aid hath helped the singer.
text.3: he gave sudās wide room and space and often hath granted wealth to him who brought oblations.
text.4: soldier unchecked warrousing battling hero unconquered from of old victorious ever.
text.5: indra the very strong hath scattered armies yea he hath slain each foe who fought against him.
text.6: thou with thy greatness hast filled full o indra even both the worlds with might o thou most mighty.
text.7: lord of bays indra brandishing his thunder is gratified with soma at the banquet.
text.8: a bull begat the bull for joy of battle and a strong mother brought forth him the manly.
text.9: he who is chief of men their armies leader is strong hero bold and fain for booty.
text.10: the people falter not nor suffer sorrow who win themselves this gods terrific spirit.
text.11: he who with sacrifices worships indra is lord of wealth lawborn and laws protector.
text.12: wheneer the elder fain would help the younger the greater cometh to the lessers present.
text.13: shall the immortal sit aloof inactive o wondrous indra bring us wondrous riches.
text.14: thy dear folk indra who present oblations are in chief place thy friends o thunderwielder.
text.15: may we be best content in this thy favour sheltered by one who slays not but preserves us.
text.16: to thee the mighty hymn hath clamoured loudly and maghavan the eloquent hath besought thee.
text.17: desire of wealth hath come upon thy singer help us then gakra to our share of riches.
text.18: place us by food which thou hast given o indra us and the wealthy patrons who command us.
text.19: let thy great power bring good to him who lauds thee ye gods preserve us evermore with blessings.
